intro: Saxifraga hariotii, commonly known as the Himalayan saxifrage, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. It is noted for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Saxifraga hariotii is often used in rock gardens and alpine landscapes due to its ornamental value and resilience.
